questions.question:
Relation R is decomposed using a set of functional dependencies, F ,and relation S is decomposed using another set of functional dependencies, G. One decomposition is definitely BCNF , the other is definitely. 3NF , but it is not known which is which. To make a guaranteed identification, which one of the following tests should be used on the decompositions ? (Assume that the closures of F and G are available).

(GATE CSE 2002)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
A B+-tree index is to be built on the Name attribute of the relation STUDENT. Assume that all student names are of length 8 bytes, disk blocks are of size 512 bytes, and index pointers are of size 4 bytes. Given this scenario, what would be the best choice of the degree (i.e. the number of pointers per node) of the B+-tree

(GATE CSE 2002)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
In the index allocation scheme of blocks to a file, the maximum possible size of the file depends on

(GATE CSE 2002)
options:
A.

The size of the blocks, and the size of the address of the blocks

B.

The number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the blocks.

C.

The size of the blocks, the number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the address of the blocks.
questions.correct_answer:
C.

The size of the blocks, the number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the address of the blocks.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
With regard to the expressive power of the formal relational query languages, which of the following statements is true ?

(GATE CSE 2002)
options:
A.

Relational algebra is more powerful than relational calculus.

B.

Relational algebra has the same power as relational calculus.

C.

Relational algebra has the same power as safe relational calculus.
questions.correct_answer:
C.

Relational algebra has the same power as safe relational calculus.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Relation R with an associated set of functional dependencies, F , is decomposed into BCNF. The redundancy (arising out of functional dependencies) in the resulting set of relations is.

(GATE CSE 2002)
options:
B.

More than zero but less than that of an equivalent 3NF decomposition
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
In SQL, relations can contain null values, and comparisons with null values are treated as unknown. Suppose all comparisons with a null value are treated as false. Which of the following pairs is not equivalent?

(GATE CSE 2000)
options:
B.

\(x=5 \; x \gt 4 \text{ and }x\lt6 \), where \(x \) is an integer
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Given relations r(w, x) and s(y, z) the result of 

 select distinct w, x from r, s
is guaranteed to be same as r, provided.

(GATE CSE 2000)
options:
A.

r has no duplicates and s is non-empty

C.

s has no duplicates and r is non-empty

D.

r and s have the same number of tuples
questions.correct_answer:
A.

r has no duplicates and s is non-empty
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Given the following relation instance.
\(\begin{array}{|l|l|l|}\hline \text{X} & \text{Y} & \text{Z} \\\hline \text{1} & \text{4} & \text{2} \\ \text{1} & \text{5} & \text{3} \\ \text{1} & \text{6} & \text{3} \\ \text{3} & \text{2} & \text{2} \\\hline \end{array}\)
Which of the following functional dependencies are satisfied by the instance?

(GATE CSE 2000)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Given the relations
employee (name, salary, dept-no), and
department (dept-no, dept-name,address),
Which of the following queries cannot be expressed using the basic relational algebra operations \(\left(\sigma, \pi,\times ,\Join, \cup, \cap,-\right)\)?

(GATE CSE 2000)
options:
B.

Employees whose name is the same as their department name
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
\(B^{+}\)-trees are preferred to binary trees in databases because

(GATE CSE 2000)
options:
A.

Disk capacities are greater than memory capacities

B.

Disk access is much slower than memory access

C.

Disk data transfer rates are much less than memory data transfer rates
questions.correct_answer:
B.

Disk access is much slower than memory access
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Which of the following is/are correct?

(GATE CSE 1999)
options:
B.

An SQL query will not work if there are no indexes on the relations

C.

SQL permits attribute names to be repeated in the same relation

questions.question:
Consider the schema \(R=(S,T, U, V)\) and the dependencies \(S \rightarrow T, T \rightarrow U, U \rightarrow V\) and \(V \rightarrow S\). Let \(R = (R1\text{ and } R2)\) be a decomposition such that \(R1 \cap R2 \neq \phi\). The decomposition is

(GATE CSE 1999)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
For the schedule given below, which of the following is correct:
\(\begin{array}{lll} \text{1} & \text{Read A} & \text{} \\ \text{2} & \text{} & \text{Read B} \\ \text{3} & \text{Write A} & \text{} \\ \text{4} & \text{} & \text{Read A} \\ \text{5} & \text{} & \text{Write A} \\ \text{6} & \text{} & \text{Write B} \\ \text{7} & \text{Read B} & \text{} \\ \text{8} & \text{Write B} & \text{} \\\end{array}\)

(GATE CSE 1999)
options:
A.

This schedule is serializable and can occur in a scheme using 2PL protocol

B.

This schedule is serializable but cannot occur in a scheme using 2PL protocol

C.

This schedule is not serializable but can occur in a scheme using 2PL protocol

D.

This schedule is not serializable and cannot occur in a scheme using 2PL protocol
questions.correct_answer:
D.

This schedule is not serializable and cannot occur in a scheme using 2PL protocol
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Let R = (A, B, C, D, E, F) be a relation scheme with the following dependencies \(C \rightarrow F, E \rightarrow A, EC \rightarrow D, A \rightarrow B\). Which one of the following is a key for R?

(GATE CSE 1999)
